items.message: River levels remain higher than normal and are expected to rise in response to the overnight rainfall. Flooding may affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly low-lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further showers are expected later today. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further alerts and warnings if required. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25/11/2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. River levels remain high but steady at Pillings Lock Gauge. No further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.  
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, throughout today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible today, Monday 24 November, and for the next few days.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Tuesday 25 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially land around the River Rye and its tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck, Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The River Bure, Spixworth Beck and surrounding Becks
items.message:
High river levels today, Monday 24 November 2025, may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible throughout today, 24 November 2025. Flooding of low lying land and roads is possible.

Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas between Horsford and Crostwick on the Spixworth Beck, and Corpusty, Saxthorpe, Itteringham, Ingworth, Aylsham and Burgh-next-Aylsham on the Bure. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10am Tuesday 25 November or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be land around the River Seven and its tributaries including Northdale Beck, Hartoft Beck, Ings Beck, Lastingham Beck, Sutherland Beck, Cropton Beck, Catter Beck, including properties in Sinnington and to the East of Normanby. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high and flooding is possible today. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Low Marishes area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected. The recent rainfall has largely moved away from the area but showery conditions are forecast for Monday. 
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding continues today.  Flooding is possible on 24 November 2025 .  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech 3.0m to 3.3m on 24/11/25 Monday morning and Cae Howel 3.5m to 3.7m on 24/11/25 Monday evening. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 25 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

High tides, strong winds and large waves this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 18:15pm to 22:15pm on 24.11.2025. 
Areas most at risk are around Hunstanton seafront.  Flood gates in the area will be closed by the Local Authority which will make access difficult. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 3.5mAODN at 20:15pm, on 24 November 2025, Wind Force 7, Northerly. No further high tides are expected over the coming days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 25 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River and lake levels remain high following recent rainfall. Flooding is possible to low lying land and roads on 24 November 2025. Levels are starting to recede and will continue to do so today. We continue to monitor the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:30AM on 25 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Pickering Beck and Costa Beck catchments
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding.  Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Particularly at the foot bridge north of Becks Isle, Wells walk and Bridge Street.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes
